title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [23 may 1866]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [23 May 1866]
text: Dear Walti will just write to let you know i have received your letter with 3 dollars in and that you think of coming to brooklynBrooklyn we will try to squeesesqueeze you in somewhere being youryou're small matty has a bedroom on the back of the entry if she dontdon't get a girl to work we will doodo quite well you must sentsend word Walt when or before you come so we will be all prepared) i feel quite smart now but it does tire me so to work to go up and down stairs the children is well and a world of trouble poor little jim i think about him often little andrew is a good looking litlelittle boy but i suppose they will get along through the dirt mr davis has gone to pensylvaniaPennsylvania for a day or so to the foundry he gets the same salary as Jeff) perbasco lives there has bought a house he is in the water works employ he was discharged for one the hot concern george is pretty well he has been troubled with boils on his arm he has had two on one arm but they seem better now the weather is cold here for the time of year but we must take it as it comesgood bieLouisa WhitmanwensdayMailed N.Y. "24 May" Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [23 May 1866]
